III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff sufficiency
Title
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10123
Section (1) A facility shall have a staffing pattern of administrative,
Description supervisory, direct care, and other staff sufficient to perform the
prescribed functions required by these administrative rules and to
provide for the needs, protection, and supervision of the residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A reported Youth B had sex with Youth C at the facility.
Investigation On 5/17/24, I spoke to Complainant 1 concerning the allegations.
Complainant 1 reported when Youth A had met with her probation
worker, she reported Youth B (who is no longer at the facility) had
sex with Youth C.
On 5/17/24, I spoke to Administrator 1. Administrator 1 reported
Youth B is no longer in the facility but in Nebraska. Administrator 1
reported Youth B had experienced past abuse and neglect. Youth
B had a tendency to make up stories while in care. Administrator 1
reported while Youth B was in placement she did file a grievance
in June 2023. The allegations were that Youth C had made
inappropriate comments and attempted to put his arm around her
shoulder and touched her leg. Administrator 1 reported they put a
safety plan in place but did not have any findings in the matter.
Administrator 1 reported Youth A and Youth C are still at the
facility.
I contacted Worker 1 on the following dates, 6/4/24 (phone and
email) and 6/24/24 but did not receive a response.
Youth A is no longer at the facility. She was placed in a facility in
Nebraska. Attempts were made to contact her on 6/4/24 and
6/24/24, but to no avail.
On 5/31/24, I completed the following interviews at the
facility:
Youth B reported Youth A had sex with Youth C in one of the
bedrooms on the unit. Youth B could not provide a specific day, a
specific time of day, or what specific staff were working at the
facility. Youth B reported Youth A told her she had sex with Youth
C. Youth B reported she did not actually see anything. Youth B
2

reported there are always three staff working on the unit and
eleven youth. Youth B reported she did not know how they would
get into a room together due to the bedrooms being locked. Youth
B reported “control room” unlocks the bedroom doors for youth
and staff. Youth B reported doors automatically lock when closed
and bedroom doors are not left open.
Youth C reported he was on the same unit as Youth A during a
part of her placement at the facility. Youth C reported there are
normally two staff on the unit with the youth. Youth C reported
bedroom doors are always closed and locked. Youth C reported
staff will check doors to make sure they are locked. Youth C
reported the “control room” unlocks the bedroom doors. Youth C
reported the youth are not allowed in anyone else’s bedroom.
Youth C reported he has never been alone with Youth A. Youth C
reported he did not have a relationship with Youth A and he never
had sex with Youth A.
Youth D reported there are twelve youth in the unit and normally
2-3 staff that are supervising the youth. Youth D reported he does
not know Youth A. Youth D reported staff radio to the “control
room” for the “control room” to unlock the bedroom doors. Youth D
reported the doors lock once closed. Youth D reported when he
goes into his room, the door is closed and locked from staff
following behind him. Youth D reported they have free time in their
group room, but they are not permitted to go into the hallway of
their bedroom area. Youth D reported it is not possible to be in
another person’s bedroom. Youth D reported the “control room”
watches the cameras and only allows the designated youth into
their rooms.
Supervisor 1 reported it would be very unlikely if a youth entered
another youth’s bedroom. Supervisor 1 reported they do not allow
youth to enter another youth’s bedroom. Supervisor 1 reported the
“control room,” locks and unlocks doors and the control room is
the room where there are cameras and the ability to lock and
unlock doors. There are staff stationed here during all shifts.
Supervisor 1 reported he handled a grievance filed by Youth A on
June 30, 2023. Supervisor 1 reported he initiated his investigation
on July 1, 2023. Allegations were that Youth A felt uncomfortable
around Youth C because he made comments pertaining to having
sexual intercourse with her. There were no findings but due to the
seriousness of the allegations a safety plan was completed on
July 1, 2023. Supervisor 1 reported he never saw any touching or
hugging between Youth A and Youth C. After the safety plan was
in place, there were no other grievances or complaints from Youth
3

A. Supervisor 1 reported there were never allegations about Youth
A and Youth C having sex until this allegation.
Documentation Reviewed:
• The grievance Youth A filed on June 30, 2023 was
reviewed and this is consistent with Supervisor 1’s
account.
• The safety plan made on July 1, 2023 was reviewed and
this is consistent with Supervisor 1’s account.
Analysis Based on interviews with youth and staff, there is not enough
evidence to validate the allegations. There is a staffing pattern
outlined by those interviewed that provides for the safety of youth.
• Control room locks and unlocks bedroom doors.
• Youth are not permitted to go into other rooms.
• Staff are present on the unit (minimally 2 staff on the unit
with staff in the control room watching live video).
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
